alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 03 at 3:22PM EST until January 06 at 7:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Cambria and Somerset. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying, poor drainage areas and along small streams and creeks. River and stream flows are elevated to near or just above bankfull levels. A couple of flood-prone, secondary road closures are likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 PM EST, Rain gauge reports indicate between 0.75 to 1.75 inches of rain have fallen so far today. This has resulted in minor flooding in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall of 0.25 inch is expected over the area through late afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Johnstown, Somerset, Westmont, Windber, Belmont, Portage, Geistown, Southmont, Meyersdale, Berlin, Friedens, Vinco, Boswell, Dale, East Conemaugh, Salix-Beauty Line Park, Davidsville, Central City, Beaverdale-Lloydell and Paint. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
